label: AB_mC20_12_a2i_c2i-001
title: CuAl Structure
comments:
(El-Broagy, 1972) use $\beta < 90^{\circ}$ and put the Cu I atom at the (2a) site with the Al I atom on the (2d) site.  The AFLOW standard uses $\beta > 90^{\circ}$ and puts Al I at (2a) and Cu I at (2d). This rewrites the lattice vectors. 
 (El-Broagy, 1972) describe this as ``a vacancy variant of the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cP2_221_a_b-002}{CsCl ($B2$) structure} and also refer to this structure as Cu$_{51}$Al$_{49}$, indicating some disorder.  This is effect is more dramatic in Cu$_{11}$In$_{9}$ (ICSD 102986), where the (2d) site is half copper and half indium.
